university_name: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
gpt_university_description: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill is a leading public research university in the United States. Founded in 1789, it is the flagship campus of the University of North Carolina system, offering undergraduate, postgraduate, and professional programs across various disciplines, including Arts & Sciences, Business, Education, Medicine, and Public Health.
gpt_location_cost_of_living: The cost of living in Chapel Hill is somewhat high compared to the national average but relatively affordable compared to larger metropolitan areas such as New York or San Francisco. Housing tends to be the largest expense, while groceries, transportation, and other daily necessities are fairly reasonable.
gpt_location_weather: Chapel Hill enjoys a temperate climate with mild winters and hot, humid summers. The average temperature ranges from 38째F (3째C) in January to 89째F (32째C) in July. The city receives about 46 inches of rain per year, with precipitation spread relatively evenly throughout the year.
gpt_location_description: Chapel Hill is a mid-sized college town located in the picturesque Piedmont region of North Carolina. Renowned for its beautiful tree-lined streets, historic districts, vibrant art scene, and diverse food options, the city maintains a charming, small-town feel while providing easy access to the opportunities and amenities of nearby Raleigh and Durham.
gpt_location_crime: Chapel Hill has a relatively low crime rate when compared to the national average, with property crimes being more common than violent crimes. The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill Police Department provides additional security and resources for the campus community.
gpt_location_transportation: Chapel Hill offers a variety of public transportation options including buses, shuttles, and bike-sharing services. The Chapel Hill Transit bus system provides fare-free transportation around the city and to nearby Carrboro. Regional connections can be made via Triangle Transit and the Amtrak train station in neighboring Durham.
